sentence.text: Here, we show that ethanol treatment (100 mM) promotes regulation of cell growth production and oxidative stress in cancer-associated fibroblasts, which is sufficient to induce myofibroblastic differentiation.

Remarkably, our results also show that antioxidants [such as N-acetyl cysteine (activation of cysteine-type endopeptidase activity involved in apoptotic process)] can effectively reverse or prevent ethanol-induced oxidative stress in cancer-associated fibroblasts, suggesting a novel strategy for cancer prevention.

entity.text: activation of cysteine-type endopeptidase activity involved in apoptotic process
